item.title: Clinical Case
item.description: A Case of Asthma Exacerbation A 22 year old female with history of asthma was admitted to the ED with shortness of breath. Her dyspnea worsened, and she failed to respond to non-invasive therapy. She was ultimately intbuated. The initial ventilation settings were: mode AC/VC, tidal volume 500 ml, respiratory rate 22 per min, PEEP 5 mmHg, Flow 60 L per min. You were called to her bedside as she has been getting progressivly more hypotensive over the past 30 minutes.
